page.title: 18THE MAN THEY COULDN'T HANG
page.content: John Lee was born in Abbotskerswell in the late 19th century.After being put in jail for pawning his employer's silver he was released by a Miss Keyse One night servants in the house smelt burning in Miss Keyes' room.They ran in and found her lying on the floor with her head battered in. Later they found blood on Lee's clothes and an oil can and knife in his room. He was tried and in half an hour condemned to death. It was then that his mum said "John will never hang." Lee kept very cool about it and said "The Lord knows I have done no wrong and he will save me." Remaining calm on execution day he even helped the executioner tie the noose.The trapdoor was pulled.Nothing happened.Twice more it was pulled.It was stamped on,oiled, tested but each time failed to open.At last Lee's sentence was commuted.
